author: potuz
content: It's a very nice write-up, and it has some surprising effects that I couldn't have had imagined, eg. you can finalize the network with almost zero balance an most validators in the exit queue. I bet you guys were surprised and enjoyed these perks when you set out to carefully plan this attack

author: arnetheduck
content: it's more fun than that: the network finalizes with *0* balance when every validator is in the exit queue -> new validators can  get inaugurated at this point

author: arnetheduck
content: I list a few at the end - the most telling one in this particular attack is that _a lot_ of validators have bled out instead of doing a voluntary exit - this is actually a detectable condition
